ygData.subject: Re: Need Brad's email address and we all need to m ail him now
ygData.msgSnippet: I am mostly against this idea for a couple of reasons.  I think that would mean that if you arent in the right place at the right time (level wise) that you
ygData.messageBody:
I am mostly against this idea for a couple of reasons. I think that would mean
that if you arent in the right place at the right time (level wise) that you
would be SOL on certain items. As large as the EQ world is, I may not be able
to hit all the 12th level spots while they are still blue and above to me
(without going to a spoiler list at least). Also, I have needed to get loot off
of greens in order to retrieve my corpse before. If this were implemented for
only the special items (requiring a LORE ITEM like tag), then that would be a
decent solution, but the first problem remains. Unfortunately I see things like
a 20th level monk doing their impression of a weed-whacker through a camp of
skels and mummies that are so totally green to them. Why? They need the loot
perhaps, but it sure does ruin it for the people who are there because it is
challenging (and appropriate) for their level. The no-loot-at-all-from-greens
plan would probably fix stuff like that, but I think that would be too heavy of
a penalty for the higher level players that need to bootstrap themselves after
an untimely
death.


Fystro of Solusek Ro




Shawn Alley <ShawnA@...> on 06/07/99 02:49:40 PM

Please respond to eqenchanters@onelist.com

To: "'eqenchanters@onelist.com'" <eqenchanters@onelist.com>
cc: (bcc: Scott McGougan/OpenSys/Star)
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Need Brad's email address and we all need to m ail
him now




From: Shawn Alley <ShawnA@...>

That seems like a good idea.

Does anyone like the idea of greens not giving special items? I know
this isn't a new idea but I hadn't thought of it for a while till now.
This would help solve the problem of big chars camping places solely for
the loot thereby excluding fledgling groups that really belong there.

-----Original Message-----
From: Scott.Mcgougan@... [mailto:Scott.Mcgougan@...]
Sent: Monday, June 07, 1999 12:39 PM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Need Brad's email address and we all need to
m ail him now


From: Scott.Mcgougan@...



The proposal I have liked the best is that of having LORE ITEM1 and LORE
ITEM2
which would limit you to one or two instances of an item. That way the
breast
plate can be
limited and the paired earrings or daggers could be limited as well.
Should be
fairly simple
to implement.


Fystro of Solusek Ro




HiFi Review <hifireview@...> on 06/07/99 02:41:45 PM

Please respond to eqenchanters@onelist.com

To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
cc: (bcc: Scott McGougan/OpenSys/Star)
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Need Brad's email address and we all need
to m ail
him now




From: HiFi Review <hifireview@...>

My concern over the one item rule is that rings, earrings, bracelets
and weapons can be used in pairs. It would be nice to be able to still
wear two bone hoop earrings or wield two barbed whips (doesn't apply to
me, but it does for my friends). One rubicite breastplate is
understandable, of course, as you can only wear one.



--- Scott Murawski <scott@...> wrote:
> From: Scott Murawski <scott@...>
>
> I disagree also.
>
> There would just be another form of camping and
> getting items. With big
> guilds,
> each character can hold one of those extra items and
> they can still sell
> them at
> high rates.
>
> So I go with the restriction of only having 1 lore
> item deal.
>
>
> >From: Shawn Alley <ShawnA@...>
> >
> >for a little bit are new characters that are
> totally buffed out with
> >extremely high end magic weapons, magic items, and
> plate armor. Is this
> >wrong? Depends on how you play the game and is
> probably fun for some
> >people. But I think much of the challenge goes out
> of the game. I've
>
> An explanation for those who've never outfitted a
> low level char with high
> end equipment.
>
> In text muds anyway, I've done that (but not in EQ).
> The reasoning (for me
> anyway) is you play your main character
> and most likely its very painful cause your learning
> the areas and whatever
> else. There's
> a sense of non-efficiency (if your a powergamer
> type). Then the thought
> is, "Man, if I could
> do this all over again, it would be so much better
> and faster". I think
> its kinda a silly thought
> (even though I think that sometimes), cause YOUR
> CHARACTER IS ALREADY
> THERE! Why would I want to
> do it over again?
>
> But the challenge is perfecting the PROCESS of
> getting to a certain level
> and not the actual level and doing it
> the most efficient way possible to become a 'master
> of that game' type of
> player. Then you could say, "I got my guy to level
> 20 in a DAY!!", and
> other powergamer people would repect you and be in
> awe.
>
> Azboklin the enchanter
>
>
